name: Ramada Plaza West Hollywood Hotel and Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little worried abou this one with some of the reviews but all unfounded.
reviews.title: This one's more than fine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room (we got the loft with the bed on a mezzanine), totally peaceful (although Saturday night I think one of our neighbours were in for party) and all round comfort and cleanliness. Free wifi makes for a nice convenience, and the only (half) critism would be that the lighting in the rooms is somewhat dim...but then I'm not there to perform surgery!
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: The front desk staff were a little cold, or formal, but not overly reliant on them, and they were always professional and able to assist.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Totally a good deal in this great neighbourhood!
reviews.title: Location location location

reviews.text: The location is good, you can walk to Sunset or La Cienega blvd in about 15mins.
reviews.title: Unbeatable WeHo location!

reviews.text: I had a horrible experience at this hotel. Horrible is not even a strong enough word. We got back to our room on Saturday night to the smoke alarm going off. Called the front desk to see what the problem was, and was rudely accused of smoking in the room. Maitenence came up to the room and noted that we were not smoking, but just trying to sleep and reset the circuit breaker to the room. The alarm went off every 30 minutes for the next two hours. Their solution was to flip the breaker after each time the alarm went off. After this went on until 4AM in the morning, they decided to TURN THE POWER OFF TO THE ROOM!!! Great solution for the alarm, I'm glad there wasn't a fire. We only had to worry about our cell phones being dead, the food in the fridge going bad, and having to go to the bathroom in complete darkness with a cell phone screen as our only light. I called down to have them turn the power back on at 6:30, so we could take a shower and leave for the airport after one hour of sleep. I am very disappointed with our stay and how this was handled at the hotel level. I have been waiting over a day for the GM to call me back after numerous messages. The funny part is that the reception voicemall has the nerve to talk about customer service. This is the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life.
reviews.title: If you are a decent person look elsewhere

reviews.text: Absolutely great hotel. Staff are friendly and the location is superb with restaurants close by. Unlike downtown LA it is very safe to walk out at night. Supermarket right across the road and plenty of coffee shops and bakeries for breakfast and lunch. Jose the Concierge is wonderful - font of information and no request too difficult. Tours to all the sights - Disneyland etc can be booked there. Have stayed 4 times and will always go back. Great value for money.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel-will definitely return

reviews.text: This was my first time staying at this Ramada, and it was a decent stay. I had one of the two floor suites, which is nothing like the picture. The room was nicely decorated, but rather small with a spiral staircase going up to the loft. THere is no restaurant and the staff could be a little nicer. I would probably stay there again.
reviews.title: Just your average hotel

reviews.text: I travelled with a friend in early july & stayed in ramada for a week. We arrived in the morning & couldnt check in but for a tip the conceirge will look after your luggage. He was very informative & advised us about the local shops etc. Everythin is within walking distance. The beverley centre shops & many eateries & a grocery store. Our rooms had a little fridge so we stocked up on water etc at the pavillion store (grocery shop) a 15 min walk right of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel, would recommend to anyone

reviews.text: The check in girl was a bit of a ditz but you get that. Elevator was slow. Pool was great and clean. Huge widescreen tv with 44 chanels and a thermostat. The lights in the room were a bit odd & you had to turn about 4 on to give the room decent light. Noise wasnt too bad, except i could hear the people above me but i still was able to sleep. Theres a drink machine (no water) & a snack machine. There is also a coin laundry & for $3 you can wash your clothes & $3 to dry your clothes in dryer. Machines only take quarters but the front desk gave me change.
reviews.title: Terrible Hotel

reviews.text: If the price is right!
reviews.title: If the price is right!

reviews.text: The Ramada Plaza Hotel and Suites in West Hollywood has a great location if you want to be close to Beverly Hills without their prices. We came from San Francisco and did not want to drive through LA. The staff arranged to have us picked up at the hotel take a tour of the city and bring us back. 24 fitness is across the street if you want a workout. Families should be warned that hotel is at the fringe of an active gay community. The other downer is parking is $27 for twenty four hours, but it does seem the norm in the urban hotel. No breakfast, but there are choices in the area and a Trader Joes across the street. Give this hotel and its friendly staff a try if you get the reduced price on the internet.
reviews.title: it was a nice stay

reviews.text: thank you for a wonderful experience ,i normally dont spend so much on a trip but this time it was worth it
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text: I got charged for the room and didn't even stay there. They didn't allow late check in and failed to mention that but was more than happy to take my money when I didn't need the room the next night. I have never stay at the ramada and will never from this experience. Orbitz was on the line with me begging for a refund due to the system error on the dates but the hotel basically said too bad. I usually stay with the Hilton and never had a problem.
reviews.title: Watch out!

reviews.text: Be ware! Filthy carpet that gave me a skin rash, broken televisions and an unfortunate run in with the property owner (an angry Australian man) who nearly ran over my wife with his car while we tried to park in the $30/day parking garage.
reviews.title: Good value for location.

reviews.text: No restaurant. No room service. Internet showed these as available.
reviews.title: Really poor in every way

reviews.text: Long journey - tired on arrival. Only coffee available in room - allergic, so, asked for tea, No: asked for milk, No: asked for bottled water, No. 'Go out and buy some'! Drinks machine in hall, but only carbonated minerals (no water at all). Late evening. Dark. I am 72 and on my own! 'Sorry, can't help you - just go out and buy food and drink - only a few minutes away'. This is in an extremely busy area on major road - I had no idea what to do. Just went to bed with nothing at all. 3-night stop - on 2nd day, tea bags appeared but no milk. Decor is dark and fairly gloomy. Not able to speak to General Manager/Owner/Franchisee - he was busy - leave a phone message. I did this twice but no reply at all. On checking out they gave me 50 dollars reduction - no apology at all from anyone. I contacted Franchise Company - they promised I would har from hotel, with an apology - nothing at all. So, we can add rudeness to the sum total of this review.
reviews.title: It's a Ramada Folks...

reviews.text: Moved to Orlando Hotel and all was wonderful - reviewed on my return to England. I left this review for Ramada in the hope I would receive an apology - but not going to happen.
reviews.title: We had no fridge and room was so noisy!

reviews.text: It's not the Four Seasons...
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
Run down property with no "atmosphere" in excellent location for WeHo
reviews.text: We stayed here over the July 4th Weekend 2011 and had a great time. We booked through an online discount website, so I think we got a great deal.

aka: Ramada Plaza Hotel-West Hollywood Hotel West Hollywood
